El código guerrero fue brutal, y el castigo era duro y violento. Un enemigo capturado en la batalla podría haber eliminado sus entrañas y metódicamente cada hueso roto mientras siguen vivos. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Warriors generalmente llevaba una taparrabos y afeitado y su piel engrasada para evitar que los enemigos de prensión ellos en combate. Nobles también llevaba una capa, así como los cascos hechos de mimbre o calabazas para la protección. Estos guerreros utilizan una variedad de armas, como la ihe (lanza corta), pololu (lanza larga), pahoa (daga de madera), y otras armas.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Bulgars were highly skilled in the equestrian arts. Their army mainly consisted of horseman because of their high skill. Every Bulgar horseman had high discipline and had several horses. However, only a single horse could be used for wartime matters, and it was forbidden to do anything else with it. It is believed that the Bulgars were the first who brought the stirrups to Europe. This gave them advantages above the other European armies of this time. The Bulgars could use bows still mounted on horses. Swords and spears were also used in war. The stirrups also increased the stability and speed of the rider.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le Bulgars étaient fortement habile dans les arts équestres. Leur armée s'est principalement composée du cavalier en raison de leur compétence élevée. Chaque cavalier de Bulgar a eu la discipline élevée et a eu plusieurs chevaux. Cependant, seulement un cheval simple pourrait être employé pour des sujets de temps de guerre, et on l'a interdit de faire toute autre chose avec lui. On le croit que le Bulgars étaient le premier qui a apporté les étriers à l'Europe. Ceci leur a donné des avantages au-dessus des autres armées européennes de ce temps. Le Bulgars a pu employer des arcs toujours montés sur des chevaux. Des épées et les lances ont été également utilisées dans la guerre. Les étriers ont également augmenté la stabilité et la vitesse du cavalier.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Das Bulgars waren in die Reiterkünste in hohem Grade erfahren. Ihre Armee bestand hauptsächlich aus Reiter wegen ihrer hohen Fähigkeit. Jeder Bulgar Reiter hatte hohe Disziplin und hatte einige Pferde. Jedoch nur ein einzelnes Pferd könnte für Kriegangelegenheiten benutzt werden, und es war verboten, um noch etwas mit ihm zu tun. Es wird geglaubt, daß das Bulgars das erste waren, wer die Steigbügel zu Europa holte. Dieses gab ihnen Vorteile über den anderen europäischen Armeen dieser Zeit. Das Bulgars konnte die Bögen benutzen, die noch an den Pferden angebracht wurden. Klingen und Stangen wurden auch im Krieg benutzt. Die Steigbügel erhöhten auch die Stabilität und die Geschwindigkeit des Mitfahrers.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il Bulgars era altamente esperto nelle arti equestrian. Il loro esercito pricipalmente ha consistito del horseman a causa dell'loro elevata specializzazione. Ogni horseman di Bulgar ha avuto alta disciplina ed ha avuto parecchi cavalli. Tuttavia, soltanto un singolo cavallo potrebbe essere usato per gli argomenti di wartime ed è stato proibito a per fargli niente altro con. Si crede che il Bulgars sia stato il primo chi ha portato le staffe ad Europa. Ciò ha dato loro i vantaggi sopra gli altri eserciti europei di questo tempo. Il Bulgars ha potuto usare gli archi ancora montati sui cavalli. Le spade ed i germogli inoltre sono stati utilizzati nella guerra. Le staffe inoltre hanno aumentato la stabilità e la velocità del rider.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El Bulgars era altamente experto en los artes ecuestres. Su ejército consistió en principalmente el jinete debido a su alta habilidad. Cada jinete de Bulgar tenía alta disciplina y tenía varios caballos. Sin embargo, solamente un solo caballo podría ser utilizado para las materias del tiempo de guerra, y fue prohibido para hacer todo lo demás con él. Se cree que el Bulgars era el primer quién trajo los estribos a Europa. Esto les dio ventajas sobre los otros ejércitos europeos de este tiempo. El Bulgars podía utilizar los arcos todavía montados en caballos. Las espadas y las lanzas también fueron utilizadas en guerra. Los estribos también aumentaron la estabilidad y la velocidad del jinete.

TEXT.English: [TAB]In Mycenaean society, the lawagetas were the "leader of the people". The word "people" refers to the army, and the lawagetas were commanders of that army. The lawagetas were powerful men who lead the armies, and received land from the king.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Dans la société de Mycénienne, les lawagetas étaient le « chef du peuple ». Le mot les « gens » se rapporte à l'armée, et les lawagetas étaient des commandants de cette armée. Les lawagetas étaient des hommes puissants qui mènent les armées, et terre reçue du roi.
TEXT.German: [TAB]In der Mykenische Gesellschaft waren die lawagetas der Führer der Leute. Das Wort Leute bezieht sich die auf Armee, und die lawagetas waren Kommandanten dieser Armee. Die lawagetas waren leistungsfähige Männer, die die Armeen führen, und empfangenes Land vom König.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Nella società di Micenea, i lawagetas erano il capo della gente. La parola la gente si riferisce all'esercito e i lawagetas erano comandanti di quell'esercito. I lawagetas erano uomini potenti che conducono gli eserciti e terra ricevuta dal re.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]En la sociedad de Micénica, los lawagetas eran el líder de la gente. La palabra gente refiere al ejército, y los lawagetas eran comandantes de ese ejército. Los lawagetas eran los hombres de gran alcance que conducen a ejércitos, y tierra recibida del rey.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Australian Light Horse were mounted troops that combined the characteristics of both cavalry and mounted infantry. They served during the Second Boer War and World War I. Their purpose as both cavalry and mounted infantry was a result of the debate in military groups in Australia concerning the future of mounted troops. On one hand, the battlefield had become dominated by machine guns and artillery and was too dangerous for mounted troops. On the other hand, the distances in Australia were too great, and the small amount and poor condition of roads were unable to support mechanized warfare. Light Horse were like mounted infantry in that they usually fought dismounted, using their horses as transport to the battlefield and as means of quick disengagement when withdrawing or retiring from a battle. Over time, most Light Horse regiments were converted to motorized infantry, armored car or armored regiments during World War II. However, a few light horse units still exist today as Royal Australian Armored Corps Cavalry units.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le cheval de sang australien étaient des troupes montées qui ont combiné les caractéristiques de la cavalerie et de l'infanterie montée. Ils ont servi pendant la deuxièmes guerre de Boer et Première Guerre Mondiale. Leur but en tant que la cavalerie et infanterie montée était un résultat de la discussion dans les groupes militaires en Australie au sujet du futur des troupes montées. D'une part, le champ de bataille était devenu dominé par les mitrailleuses et l'artillerie et était trop dangereux pour les troupes montées. D'une part, les distances en Australie étaient trop grandes, et un peu et l'état pauvre des routes ne pouvaient pas soutenir la guerre mécanisée. Le cheval de sang étaient comme l'infanterie montée du fait elles ont habituellement combattu démonté, en utilisant leurs chevaux en tant que transport au champ de bataille et en tant que moyens du dégagement rapide en se retirant ou en se retirant d'une bataille. Avec le temps, la plupart des régiments de cheval de sang ont été convertis en infanterie motorisée, véhicule blindé ou régiments blindés pendant la deuxième guerre mondiale. Cependant, quelques unités de cheval de sang existent toujours aujourd'hui en tant qu'unités blindées australiennes royales de cavalerie de corps.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Das australische helle Pferd waren angebrachte Truppen, die die Eigenschaften der Kavallerie und der angebrachten Infanterie kombinierten. Sie dienten während des zweiten Boer-Krieges und des Ersten Weltkrieges. Ihr Zweck als Kavallerie und angebrachte Infanterie war ein Resultat der Debatte in den militärischen Gruppen in Australien hinsichtlich ist der Zukunft der angebrachten Truppen. Einerseits war das Schlachtfeld durch Maschine Gewehren und Artillerie vorherrsch geworden und war für angebrachte Truppen zu gefährlich. Einerseits waren die Abstände in Australien zu groß, und etwas und der schlechte Zustand der Straßen waren nicht imstande, mechanisierte Kriegsführung zu stützen. Helles Pferd waren wie angebrachte Infanterie dadurch, daß sie normalerweise abgenommen kämpften mit ihren Pferden als Transport zum Schlachtfeld und als Mittel der schnellen Befreiung, als, zurücktretend oder von einer Schlacht zurückziehend. Über Zeit wurden die meisten helles Pferd Regimente in motorisierte Infanterie, Panzerkampfwagen oder gepanzerte Regimente während des Zweiten Weltkrieges umgewandelt. Jedoch bestehen einige helles Pferd Maßeinheiten noch heute als königliche australische gepanzerte Korps-Kavalleriemaßeinheiten.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il cavallo chiaro australiano era truppe montate che hanno unito le caratteristiche sia di cavalry che di fanteria montata. Hanno servito durante la seconda guerra di Boer e la guerra mondiale I. Il loro scopo come sia cavalry che fanteria montata era un risultato del dibattito nei gruppi militari in Australia riguardo al futuro delle truppe montate. Su una mano, il campo di battaglia era stato dominato dalle pistole e dall'artiglieria di macchina ed era troppo pericoloso per le truppe montate. D'altra parte, le distanze in Australia erano troppo grandi e piccola lo stato dei poveri e di quantità delle strade non poteva sostenere la guerra meccanizzata. Il cavallo chiaro era come fanteria montata in quanto hanno combattuto solitamente smontato, usando i loro cavalli come trasporto al campo di battaglia e come mezzi di disimpegno rapido quando si ritira o lasciando una battaglia. Col tempo, la maggior parte dei regiments del cavallo chiaro sono stati convertiti in fanteria motorizzata, in autoblindata o in regiments corazzati durante la seconda guerra mondiale. Tuttavia, alcune unità del cavallo chiaro ancora esistono oggi come unità corazzate australiane reali del Cavalry di corpo.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El caballo ligero australiano era las tropas montadas que combinaron las características de la caballería y de la infantería montada. Sirvieron durante la segunda guerra de Boer y Primera Guerra Mundial. Su propósito como la caballería e infantería montada era un resultado del discusión en grupos militares en Australia referente al futuro de tropas montadas. Por un lado, el campo de batalla se había dominado por las ametralladoras y la artillería y era demasiado peligroso para las tropas montadas. Por otra parte, las distancias en Australia eran demasiado grandes, y la cantidad pequeña y la condición pobre de caminos no podían apoyar la guerra mecanizada. El caballo ligero era como la infantería montada en que ella luchó generalmente desmontado, usando sus caballos como transporte al campo de batalla y como medios de la retirada rápida al retirarse o retirándose de una batalla. En un cierto plazo, la mayoría de los regimientos del caballo ligero fueron convertidos a la infantería motorizada, al vehículo blindado o a los regimientos armados durante la Segunda Guerra Mundial. Sin embargo, algunas unidades del caballo ligero todavía existen hoy como unidades armadas australianas reales de la caballería del cuerpo.

TEXT.English: The Maccabees were a Jewish national liberation movement that fought for independence from Antiochus IV Epiphanes. The Maccabees founded the Hasmonean Dynasty of Israel. In 167 BC, after Antiochus forbade Jewish practice, a priest from Modiin, Mattathias the Hasmonean, sparked a revolt by refusing to worship Greek gods. After Mattathiass death, his son Judah Maccabee led an army of Jews against the Seleucid Dynasty. The term Maccabees is used to describe the army of Judah Maccabee. [PARAGRAPH:1] The revolt included many individual battles. In many, the Maccabeean forces won victory for their use of guerrilla tactics. After the revolt, the Maccabees cleansed the temple, and declared Judah Maccabee a priest. A Syrian army was sent to destroy the revolt, but returned after the death of Antiochus. [PARAGRAPH:1] After the revolt, the Maccabees were unsure whether to continue fighting, seeing their military success in the revolt. Those who continued to fight were led by Judah Maccabee. Judah Maccabee died in 160 BC in battle. Judah was succeeded by his younger brother Jonathan, who was already a high priest. Jonathan made treaties with foreign nations, causing more disputes between those who wanted religious freedom over political power. In 142 BC, Jonathan died. He was succeeded by the last son of Mattathias, Simon. That same year, Demetrius, king of Syria, granted the Jews independence from Syria and Simon went on to found the Hasmonean dynasty. [PARAGRAPH:1] Every year, Jews celebrate Hannukah to celebrate and recognize Judah Maccabees victory over the Seleucids and related miracles.
TEXT.French: Le Maccabees étaient un mouvement national juif de libération qui a combattu pour l'indépendance d'Antiochus IV Epiphanes. Le Maccabees a fondé la dynastie de Hasmonean de l'Israel. Dans 167 AVANT JÉSUS CHRIST, après qu'Antiochus ait interdit la pratique juive, un prêtre de Modiin, Mattathias le Hasmonean, a étincelé une révolte en refusant d'adorer les dieux grecs. Après la mort de Mattathias, son fils Judah Maccabee a mené une armée des juifs contre la dynastie de Seleucid. Le terme Maccabees est employé pour décrire l'armée de Judah Maccabee. [PARAGRAPH : 1] La révolte a inclus beaucoup de différentes batailles. Dans beaucoup, les forces de Maccabeean ont gagné la victoire pour leur usage de la tactique de guérillero. Après la révolte, le Maccabees a nettoyé le temple, et a déclaré Judah Maccabee un prêtre. Une armée syrienne a été envoyée pour détruire la révolte, mais est retournée après la mort d'Antiochus. [PARAGRAPH : 1] Après la révolte, le Maccabees étaient incertain si continuer de combattre, voyant leur succès militaire dans la révolte. Ceux qui ont continué à combattre ont été menés par Judah Maccabee. Judah Maccabee est mort dans 160 AVANT JÉSUS CHRIST dans la bataille. Judah a été réussi par son plus jeune frère Jonathan, qui était déjà un haut prêtre. Jonathan a fait des traités avec des nations étrangères, causant plus de conflits entre ceux qui ont voulu la puissance politique d'excédent religieux de liberté. Dans 142 AVANT JÉSUS CHRIST, Jonathan est mort. Il a été réussi par le dernier fils de Mattathias, Simon. Que la même année, Demetrius, roi de la Syrie, a accordé aux juifs l'indépendance de Syrie et Simon a continué à a trouvé la dynastie de Hasmonean. [PARAGRAPH : 1] Chaque année, juifs célèbrent Hannukah pour célébrer et identifier la victoire de Judah Maccabee sur le Seleucids et les miracles relatifs.
TEXT.German: Das Maccabees waren eine jüdische nationale Befreiungbewegung, die für Unabhängigkeit von Antiochus IV Epiphanes kämpfte. Das Maccabees gründete die Hasmonean Dynastie von Israel. In 167 BC, nachdem Antiochus jüdische Praxis verbot, funkte ein Priester von Modiin, Mattathias das Hasmonean, ein Aufruhr, indem er ablehnte, griechische Götter anzubeten. Nach Tod Mattathiass führte sein Sohn Judah Maccabee eine Armee der Juden gegen die Seleucid Dynastie. Die Bezeichnung Maccabees wird verwendet, um die Armee von Judah Maccabee zu beschreiben. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Der Aufruhr schloß viele einzelne Schlachten ein. In vielen gewannen die Maccabeean Kräfte Sieg für ihren Gebrauch von Bandenkämpfertaktiken. Nach dem Aufruhr reinigte das Maccabees den Bügel und erklärte Judah Maccabee ein Priester. Eine syrische Armee wurde gesendet, um den Aufruhr zu zerstören, aber zurückging nach dem Tod von Antiochus. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Nach dem Aufruhr waren das Maccabees unsicher, ob man fortfährt zu kämpfen und ihren militärischen Erfolg im Aufruhr sieht. Die, die fortfuhren zu kämpfen, wurden von Judah Maccabee geführt. Judah Maccabee starb in 160 BC in der Schlacht. Judah wurde von seinem jüngeren Bruder Jonathan gefolgt, der bereits ein hoher Priester war. Jonathan bildete Verträge mit den fremden Nationen und verursachte mehr Debatten zwischen denen, die politische Energie des frommen Freiheit überschusses wünschten. In 142 BC, starb Jonathan. Er wurde vom letzten Sohn von Mattathias, Simon gefolgt. Daß das gleiche Jahr, Demetrius, König von Syrien, den Juden Unabhängigkeit von Syrien und von Simon bewilligte, gingen an zu fanden die Hasmonean Dynastie. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Jedes Jahr, Juden feiern Hannukah, um Judah Maccabees Sieg über dem Seleucids und den in Verbindung stehenden Wundern zu feiern und zu erkennen.
TEXT.Italian: Il Maccabees era un movimento nazionale ebreo di liberazione che ha combattuto per indipendenza da Antiochus IV Epiphanes. Il Maccabees ha fondato il Dynasty di Hasmonean dell'Israele. In 167 BC, dopo che Antiochus proibisse alla pratica ebrea, un priest da Modiin, Mattathias il Hasmonean, ha scintillato una sommossa rifiutando di adorare i dii greci. Dopo la morte del Mattathias, il suo figlio Judah Maccabee ha condotto un esercito degli ebrei contro il Dynasty di Seleucid. Il termine Maccabees è usato per descrivere l'esercito di Judah Maccabee. [PARAGRAPH: 1] La sommossa ha incluso molte diverse battaglie. In molti, le forze di Maccabeean hanno vinto la vittoria per il loro uso delle tattiche del guerrigliero. Dopo la sommossa, il Maccabees ha pulito il tempiale ed ha dichiarato Judah Maccabee un priest. Un esercito siriano è stato trasmesso per distruggere la sommossa, ma ha rinviato dopo la morte di Antiochus. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Dopo la sommossa, il Maccabees era incerto se continuare il combattimento, vedente il loro successo militare nella sommossa. Coloro che ha continuato a combattere sono stati condotti da Judah Maccabee. Judah Maccabee è morto BC in 160 nella battaglia. Judah è stato riuscito dal suo fratello più giovane Jonathan, che era già un alto priest. Jonathan ha fatto i trattati con le nazioni straniere, causanti più dispute fra coloro che ha desiderato l'alimentazione politica dell'eccedenza religiosa di libertà. In 142 BC, Jonathan morto. È stato riuscito dall'ultimo figlio di Mattathias, Simon. Che lo stesso anno, Demetrius, re della Siria, ha assegnato agli ebrei l'indipendenza dalla Siria e da Simon ha continuato a ha trovato il dynasty di Hasmonean. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Ogni anno, ebrei celebra Hannukah per celebrare e riconoscere la vittoria del Judah Maccabee sopra il Seleucids ed i miracoli relativi.
TEXT.Spanish: El Maccabees era un movimiento nacional judío de la liberación que luchó para la independencia de Antiochus IV Epiphanes. El Maccabees fundó la dinastía de Hasmonean de Israel. En 167 A.C., después de que Antiochus prohibiera práctica judía, un sacerdote de Modiin, Mattathias el Hasmonean, chispeó una rebelión rechazando adorar a dioses griegos. Después de la muerte de Mattathias, su hijo Judah Maccabee condujo a ejército de judíos contra la dinastía de Seleucid. El término Maccabees se utiliza para describir al ejército de Judah Maccabee. [PARAGRAPH: 1] La rebelión incluyó muchas batallas individuales. En muchos, las fuerzas de Maccabeean ganaron la victoria para su uso de las táctica del guerrilla. Después de la rebelión, el Maccabees limpió el templo, y declaró a Judah Maccabee un sacerdote. Enviaron para destruir la rebelión, pero volvió un ejército sirio después de la muerte de Antiochus. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Después de la rebelión, el Maccabees era inseguro si continuar luchando, viendo su éxito militar en la rebelión. A Judah Maccabee condujeron los que continuaron luchando. Judah Maccabee murió en 160 A.C. en batalla. A su hermano más joven Jonatán tuvo éxito a Judah, que era ya sacerdote alto. Jonatán hizo tratados con las naciones extranjeras, causando más conflictos entre los que desearon energía política del excedente religioso de la libertad. En 142 A.C., Jonatán muerto. Al hijo pasado de Mattathias lo tuvo éxito, Simon. Que el mismo año, Demetrius, rey de Siria, concedió a judíos independencia de Siria y de Simon fue encendido a encontró la dinastía de Hasmonean. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Cada año, judíos celebra Hannukah para celebrar y para reconocer la victoria de Judah Maccabee sobre el Seleucids y los milagros relacionados.

TEXT.English: [TAB]In 711, the Moors invaded Visigoth, Christian Hispania. Under their leader, an African Berber general named Tariq ibn-Ziyad, they brought most of the Iberian Peninsula under Islamic rule in an eight-year campaign. They attempted to move northeast across the Pyrenees Mountains but were defeated by the Frank, Charles Martel, at the Battle of Tours in 732. The Moors ruled in the Iberian peninsula, except for areas in the northwest and the largely Basque regions in the Pyrenees, and in North Africa for several decades. Though the number of "Moors" remained small, they gained large numbers of converts. According to Ronald Segal, author of "Islam's Black Slaves", some 5.6 million of Iberia's 7 million inhabitants were Muslim by 1200, virtually all of them native inhabitants.

[TAB]Pencak Silat is a Malay word meaning "Self-defense" or "Fighting" and its roots go very far back into the islands of Indonesia in the far east. The exact origins of Pencak Silat are not known but what is known is that it is a Martial tradition that extends to many different regions of the world and that it is an effective form of combative movement.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Hindu Empire of Majapahit created the foundation and systemization of the indigenous fighting techniques of Indonesia. The Majapahit warriors were a steeled group of men and were able to drive back the attacks of ruthless generals like Kau Sing and Kublai Khan with the methods they employed for close combat. It was in this empire that we see the famous Kris sword being truly perfected and becoming part and parcel with Silat.

[TAB]The rising of the menalamba, the Red Shawls, was a revolt against French colonial rule in Madagascar in the 1890s. In the century before the French conquest, rising tensions between modernising kings, self-seeking Christian oligarchs and reactionary guardians of the ancient talismans had weakened the capacity of the kingdom to resist. But just two months after the French occupation of the capital the menalamba revivalist movement sought to restore the customs of the ancestors and expel the French from the island. The civil war of 1895 fully described here for the first time, has cast a shadow on Malagasy politics ever since.

[TAB]The word "mambises" originated in Santo Domingo, after a brave Negro Spanish officer (Juan Ethninius Mamby) joined the Dominicans in the fight for independence in 1846. The Spanish soldiers referred to the insurgents as "the men of Mamby," and "mambies." When Cuba's first war of independence (known as the Ten Year War) broke out in 1868, some of the same soldiers were assigned to the island, importing what had, by then, become a derogatory Spanish slur. The Cuban rebels adopted the name with pride. The rebels had no choice but to become effective guerrilla-style warriors using the environment, the element of surprise, a fast horse and a machete.

[TAB]The kingdom of Songhai provides another prominent body of documented achievements in the use of light cavalry for the purposes of territorial gain and empire building. Malian and Songhai battle formations, or mandekalu, entailed the use of light cavalry forces bearing padded armor, spears or javelins, and imported swords. Such forces were highly effective in combat with enemy soldiers within the range of the savanna; however, these same cavalry forces were far less effective in the forested areas to the south of the Niger River or within tsetse-fly-ridden regions where horses were vulnerable. Following on the heels of the cavalry were the infantrymen, who typically bore full armor, iron-tipped spears, and poisoned arrows.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ultimately, the development of sophisticated military organizations, advanced strategies and tactics, effective diplomacy, and weaponry of the kingdoms of Mali, Songhai, and successor states of West Africa, was such that these kingdoms largely dictated the conditions of European and Arabic commerce in West Africa well into the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries.

[TAB]The Picunche (a mapudungun word meaning "North People"), also referred to as picones by the Spanish, were a mapudungun speaking Chilean people living to the north of the Mapuches or Araucanians (a name given to those Mapuche living between the Itata and Toltén Rivers) and south of the Choapa River and the Diaguitas. Until the Conquest of Chile the Itata was the natural limit between the Mapuche, located to the south, and Picunche, to the north. During the Inca attempt to conquer Chile the southern Picunche peoples that successfully resisted them were later known as the Promaucaes. The Picunche living north of the Promaucaes were called Quillotanes (those living in the Aconcagua River valley north to the Choapa) and Mapochoes (those living in the Maipo River basin) by the Spanish, and were part of the Inca Empire at the time when the first Spaniards arrived in Chile. Among the peoples the Spanish called the Promaucaes, the people of the Rapel River valley were particularly called by this name by the Spanish. Those of the Mataquito River valley were called the Cures. The people in the Maule River valley and to the south were distinguished as Maules and those to the south of the Maules and north of the Itata were known as Cauqui by the Inca and Cauquenes by the Spanish and that gave their name to Cauquenes River. They did not survive into the present day, having died out during the colonial period.

[TAB] The most influential Hurrian state, Mitanni, gained much of its power through military might. The elite warriors of their army were charioteers, called maryannu. The maryannu were nobles who could afford chariots, and each had a handful of attendants, including an archer that would fight with them from the chariot and servants that would take care of the horses. The Mitanni chariots themselves served as a model for the chariots of neighboring empires. It could even be said that the system of having elite nobles who formed the chariot army was started by the Mitanni. Mitanni chariots were sleek, with two wheels and a team of two horses. Both the horses and the maryannu were well armored, being covered in scale armor made of bronze or iron. The tactic of surrounding an enemy with chariots to constantly attack them with missile fire was developed by the Mitanni. The Mitanni even created the tactic of using chariots as an impact weapon.
TEXT.French: [TAB] Le plus influents hourrite état, Mitaniens, a gagné une grande partie de son pouvoir par la force militaire. Les guerriers d'élite de leur armée de char, appelé maryannu. Le maryannu étaient nobles qui en avaient les moyens chars, et chacun avait une poignée de participants, y compris un archer qui lutte avec eux dès le char et des serviteurs qui prennent soin des chevaux. Le Mitaniens chars eux-mêmes servi de modèle pour les chars des empires voisins. On pourrait même dire que le système d'élite des nobles qui ont formé le char armée a été lancée par les Mitaniens. Mitaniens chars ont été épurées, avec deux roues et une équipe de deux chevaux. Les chevaux et les maryannu étaient bien blindée, étant traitées dans l'échelle d'armure en bronze ou en fer. La tactique de l'ennemi avec environnantes chars de constamment les attaquer avec des missiles de feu a été mis au point par le Mitaniens. Le Mitaniens même créé en utilisant la tactique de chars comme une arme d'impact.
TEXT.German: [TAB] Die einflussreichsten Hurrian Staat, Mitanni, erhielt viel von ihrer Macht durch militärische Macht. Die Elite-Krieger der Armee wurden charioteers, genannt maryannu. Die maryannu waren Adligen, der Wagen leisten könnte, und jeder hatte eine Handvoll der Teilnehmer, darunter ein Bogenschütze, würde Kampf mit ihnen aus dem Wagen und Knechte, die kümmern sich um die Pferde. Die Mitanni Wagen selbst diente als Vorbild für die Wagen der benachbarten Imperien. Man könnte sogar sagen, dass das System mit der Elite, die Adligen bildeten den Wagen Armee wurde von der Mitanni. Mitanni Wagen waren schnörkellose, mit zwei Rädern und einem Team von zwei Pferden. Sowohl die Pferde und die maryannu waren gut gepanzert, die in Umfang Rüstungen aus Bronze oder Eisen. Die Taktik der Umgebung ein Feind mit Wagen ständig mit Raketen angreifen Feuer wurde von der Mitanni. Die Mitanni auch die Taktik der Verwendung von Wagen als Waffe Auswirkungen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB] Il più influenti Hurrian Stato, Mitanni, guadagnato molto del suo potere attraverso la forza militare. L'élite del loro esercito di guerrieri erano charioteers, chiamato maryannu. Il maryannu erano nobili, che potevano permettersi carri, e ciascuno ha avuto una manciata di partecipanti, tra cui un arciere che si lotta con loro dal carro e servitori che si occupa di cavalli. Il Mitanni carri stessi servita come modello per i carri di imperi vicini. Si potrebbe anche dire che il sistema di élite nobili che formavano il carro esercito è stato avviato dalla Mitanni. Mitanni carri erano eleganti, con due ruote e un team di due cavalli. Entrambi i cavalli e la maryannu erano ben armate, possono essere coperti in scala armatura in bronzo o in ferro. La tattica di un nemico circostante con carri costantemente al loro attacco con missili fuoco è stato sviluppato dalla Mitanni. Il Mitanni anche creato la tattica di carri utilizzando come arma un impatto.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB] El estado más influyentes hurritas, Mitanni, obtuvo gran parte de su poder a través de la fuerza militar. Los guerreros de élite de su ejército se charioteers, llamado maryannu. El maryannu fueron nobles que podían permitirse carros, y cada uno de ellos había un puñado de asistentes, incluido un arquero que lucha con ellos de todo corazón, y los funcionarios que se ocupan de los caballos. El Mitanni carros propios servido de modelo para los carros de los imperios vecinos. Incluso podría decirse que el sistema de tener élite nobles que formaban el ejército carro fue iniciado por la Mitanni. Mitanni carros fueron elegante, con dos ruedas y un equipo de dos caballos. Tanto los caballos y los maryannu estaban bien blindados, que se tratan en la escala armadura de bronce o de hierro. La táctica de en torno a un enemigo con carros a ellos constantemente ataque con fuego de misiles fue desarrollado por el Mitanni. El Mitanni incluso creó la táctica de utilizar un impacto carros como arma.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Medjay were Nubian nomads who became part of the Egyptian police force during the Eighteenth Dynasty. Perhaps because the Medjay had previously established a history of serving in the Egyptian army that they blended well into Egyptian society. They had the responsibility of protecting towns in western Thebes and being responsible to its mayor.[PARAGRAPH: 2] The Medjay also served as tomb guardians during the contruction of the royal necropolis at Deir el-Medina. The Medjay had the responsibility of ensuring the tomb's safety, inspecting the tomb, protecting the workers, ensuring that the workers were behaving well, and sometimes helping the workers. Some of their other obligations included acting as messengers, interrogating thieves, being witnesses for administrative functions, and inflicting punishments.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le Medjay étaient les nomades de Nubian qui sont devenus une partie de la force égyptienne de police pendant la dix-huitième dynastie. Peut-être parce que le Medjay avait précédemment établi une histoire de servir dans l'armée égyptienne qu'elle a bien mélangée dans la société égyptienne. Elle a eu la responsabilité de protéger des villes dans Thebes occidental et d'être responsable à son maire. Le Medjay a également servi de gardiens de tombeau pendant le contruction de la nécropole royale à EL-Medina de Deir. Le Medjay a eu la responsabilité d'assurer la sûreté du tombeau, d'inspecter le tombeau, de protéger les ouvriers, de s'assurer que les ouvriers se comportaient bien, et d'aider parfois les ouvriers. Certains de leurs autres engagements ont inclus agir en tant que messagers, interroger des voleurs, être des témoins pour des fonctions administratives, et infliger des punitions.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Das Medjay waren Nubian Nomaden, die Teil der ägyptischen Polizeikraft während der achtzehnten Dynastie wurden. Möglicherweise, weil das Medjay vorher eine Geschichte des Dienens in der ägyptischen Armee hergestellt hatte, die sie gut in ägyptische Gesellschaft mischten. Sie hatten die Verantwortlichkeit des Schützens der Städte in WestThebes und des Seins verantwortlich zu seinem Bürgermeister. Das Medjay diente auch als Grabwächter während des contruction des königlichen Necropolis an Deir EL-Medina. Das Medjay hatte die Verantwortlichkeit des Sicherstellens der Sicherheit des Grabs, des Kontrollierens des Grabs, des Schützens der Arbeiter, des Sicherstellens, daß die Arbeiter sich gut benahmen, und den Arbeitern manchmal helfen. Einige ihrer anderen Verpflichtungen schlossen das Dienen als Kuriere, die Abfragung der Diebe, Sein Zeugen für administrative Funktionen und das Zufügen von Bestrafungen mit ein.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il Medjay era nomads di Nubian che si sono trasformati in in parte della forza egiziana della polizia durante il diciottesimo Dynasty. Forse perché il Medjay precedentemente aveva stabilito una storia di servire nell'esercito egiziano che ha mescolato bene nella società egiziana. Ha avuta la responsabilità di protezione delle città in Thebes occidentale e dell'essere responsabili al relativo sindaco. Il Medjay inoltre ha servito da guardiani della tomba durante il contruction del necropolis reale a EL-Medina di Deir. Il Medjay ha avuto la responsabilità di accertare la sicurezza della tomba, di controllo della tomba, di protezione degli operai, di accertarsi che gli operai stessero comportando bene ed a volte di assistenza degli operai. Alcuni dei loro altri obblighi hanno incluso fungere da messaggeri, la consultazione dei ladri, essere testimoni per le funzioni amministrative ed infliggere le punizioni.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El Medjay era los nómadas de Nubian que hicieron parte de la fuerza egipcia del policía durante la décimo octava dinastía. Quizás porque el Medjay había establecido previamente una historia de servir en el ejército egipcio a que él mezcló bien en sociedad egipcia. Él tenía la responsabilidad de proteger ciudades en Thebes occidental y de ser responsable a su alcalde. El Medjay también sirvió como guardas de la tumba durante el contruction de la necrópolis real en EL-Medina de Deir. El Medjay tenía la responsabilidad de asegurar la seguridad de la tumba, de examinar la tumba, de proteger a los trabajadores, de asegurarse de que los trabajadores se comportaban bien, y a veces de ayudar a los trabajadores. Algunas de sus otras obligaciones incluyeron actuar como mensajeros, la interrogación de ladrones, ser testigos para las funciones administrativas, e infligir castigos.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The mamluks were slaves trained as warriors by various Arab leaders, partially because early believers in Islam would not fight each other. Slave warriors got around this ban. The mamluks were well trained and highly motivated. A mamluk army from Egypt won a rare victory against the Mongols in Syria, turning these barbarian horsemen back from the Nile and North Africa. In time the mamluks rose up against their Arab rulers and took control themselves. When Napoleon invaded Egypt in the eighteenth century, he defeated a mamluk army at the Battle of the Pyramids.

[TAB]Rurales was the name commonly used to designate the Mexican Guardia Rural (Rural Guard): a force of mounted police or gendarmerie that existed between 1861 and 1914. In modern Mexico the name is applied to members of a part-time rural defence corps.[PARAGRAPH:1]The image of the Rurales as a ruthless and efficient organisation, which seldom took prisoners under the notorious ley fuga and inevitably got its man, was deliberately fostered under the Porfirian regime. However, research during the 1970s involving detailed examination of the records of the corps indicated that the Rurales were neither as effective nor as brutal as regime publicists had suggested. Never numbering more than about 4,000 men located in small detachments, the Rurales were too thinly spread to ever completely eliminate unrest in the Mexican countryside. They did however impose a superficial order, especially in the central regions around Mexico City, which encouraged the foreign investment sought by Díaz and his científico advisers . To a certain extent the regime saw the Rurales as a counterweight to the much larger Federal army and in the later years of the regime they were increasingly used to control industrial unrest, in addition to their traditional task of patrolling country areas.

[TAB]The archeological evidence shows presence of huge watchtowers and warlike longboats from the Minoan era. However, there is no evidence of real war or any type of standing army in the Minoan Civilzation. It is possible that these were all elements to show status among the Minoan City States. Still the Minoans housed remerkable smith skills and Minoan smiths were renowned in the classical world and many of them worked abroud in Mainland Greece.[PARAGRAPH:1](Wikipedia: Minoan Civilization)

[TAB] Moche settlements in the Jequetepeque Valley were characterized by fortifications and defensive works. While there is no evidence of a foreign invasion, as many scholars have suggested in the past (i.e. a Huari invasion), there is some evidence of social unrest, possibly the result of climatic changes as factions fought for control over scarce resources.

[TAB]The Royal Canadian Mounted Police was organized as the Northwest Mounted Police to bring law and order to the Canadian West. In 1920, the name was changed to its present title. The corps gained a romantic reputation for daring missions and persistence in trailing criminals. The force originally numbered to 300 men and came to be known as Red Coats, Riders of the Plains, and, most commonly, Mounties. The force later absorbed the provincial police forces of the all the territories and provinces except Quebec and Ontario. It enforces all federal and provincial laws and takes part in selected international peacekeeping activities. The force currently numbers to about 16,000.
TEXT.French: [TAB]La police montée canadienne royale a été organisée en tant que police montée du nord-ouest pour apporter la loi et l'ordre à l'ouest canadien. En 1920, le nom a été changé en son titre actuel. Les corps ont gagné une réputation romantique pour des missions audacieuses et la persistance dans les criminels de remorquage. La force à l'origine numérotée à 300 hommes et est venue pour être connue en tant que les manteaux rouges, les cavaliers des plaines, et, le plus généralement, Mounties. La force plus tard a absorbé les forces provinciales de police des tous territoires et provinces excepté le Québec et l'Ontario. Il impose toutes les lois fédérales et provinciales et participe aux activités internationales choisies de maintien de la paix. La force numérote actuellement environ à 16.000.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die königliche kanadische berittene Polizei wurde als die berittene Nordwestpolizei organisiert, um Gesetz und Auftrag zum kanadischen Westen zu holen. 1920 wurde der Name zu seinem anwesenden Titel geändert. Das Korps gewann ein romantisches Renommee für verwegene Missionen und Ausdauer in schleppenden Verbrechern. Die Kraft ursprünglich numerierte zu 300 Männern und kam, als rote Mäntel, Mitfahrer der Ebenen und, Mounties am allgemeinsten bekannt. Die Kraft sog später die provinziellen Polizeikräfte der aller Gegenden und der Provinzen ausgenommen Quebec und Ontario auf. Es erzwingt alle Bundes- und provinziellen Gesetze und nimmt an vorgewählten internationalen Friedenssicherungtätigkeiten teil. Die Kraft numeriert z.Z. bis ungefähr 16.000.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]La polizia montata canadese reale è stata organizzata come la polizia montata di nord-ovest per portare la legge e l'ordine all'ovest canadese. In 1920, il nome è stato cambiato al relativo titolo attuale. Il corpo ha guadagnato una reputazione romantica per le missioni daring e la persistenza in criminali strascicanti. La forza originalmente numerata a 300 uomini ed è venuto essere conosciuta il più comunemente come i cappotti rossi, i Riders delle pianure e, Mounties. La forza più successivamente ha assorbito le forze provinciali della polizia dei tutti i territori e province tranne la Quebec ed Ontario. Fa rispettare tutte le leggi federali e provinciali e partecipa alle attività internazionali selezionate di mantenimento della pace. La forza attualmente numera a circa 16.000.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Organizaron al policía montado canadiense real como el policía montado del noroeste para traer ley y orden al oeste canadiense. En 1920, el nombre fue cambiado a su actual título. El cuerpo ganó una reputación romántica para las misiones atrevidas y persistencia en criminales que se arrastraban. La fuerza numeró a 300 hombres y vino originalmente ser conocida como las capas rojas, los jinetes de los llanos, y, lo más comúnmente posible, Mounties. La fuerza absorbió más adelante las fuerzas provinciales del policía de los todos los territorios y provincias excepto Quebec y Ontario. Hace cumplir todos los leyes federales y provinciales y participa en actividades pacificadoras internacionales seleccionadas. La fuerza numera actualmente a cerca de 16.000.

TEXT.English: [TAB]In 1693 the Portuguese were defeated by the Rozwi. The Rozwi were formed from several Shona states that dominated the plateau of present-day Zimbabwe at the time. The Portuguese were driven off the central plateau and only retained a nominal presence at one of the fairs in the eastern highlands. The whole of present-day Zimbabwe was brought under the control of Changamire and became known as the Rozwi Empire. This fierce tribe of warriors was to be known as the Rozvi people and after driving the Portuguese out of the area, went on to establish the Rozvi Empire.

[TAB]Digger is New Zealand and Australian military slang term for soldiers from New Zealand and Australia. It originated during World War I. There are numerous theories about the origin of the term. Before the war, the term "digger" had been widely used in Australasia to mean a miner, or a Kauri gum-digger in New Zealand. On 25 April 1915, General Sir Ian Hamilton sent a message to the commander of the Australian and New Zealand Army Corps (ANZAC), General William Birdwood, following the landing at Gallipoli. It contained the postscript: "P.S.-You have got through the difficult business, now you have only to dig, dig, dig, until you are safe."

[TAB]The NA Divisions are supported by Combat Support Arms namely; artillery, engineers and signals. The type of support they provide and the sizes of the supported formation determine the size and composition of each support arm. The NA Artillery is divided into field and air defence artillery based on the roles they perform. The artillery acquires targets, coordinates all fire power resources available and delivers such firepower in the battlefield so that the enemy can neither interfere with our operations from air and ground nor develop its own resources effectively.

[TAB]A hersir was a local military commander of a hundred and owed allegiance to a jarl or king. They were also aspiring landowners, and, like the middle class in many feudal societies, supported the kings in their centralization of power. The hersir was often equipped with a conical helmet and a short mail coat. Most would wield an iron sword, mostly augmented with a wooden shield. They were also known to wield one- or even two-handed axes. The hersir would always fight on foot, usually as part of a shield wall formation. Another formation was also used, the Svinfylking, which was a variation to the shield wall but with several wedge like formations pointing towards the enemy creating a zig zag pattern. Although excellent against other foot troops the Vikings were frequently defeated by mounted troops.

[TAB]Obsidian was used by American Indians and many other primitive peoples for weapons, implements, tools, and ornaments and by the ancient Aztecs, Olmecs and Greeks for mirrors. Because of its conchoidal fracture (smooth curved surfaces and sharp edges), the sharpest stone artifacts were fashioned from obsidian; some of these, mostly arrowheads, have been dated by means of the hydration rinds that form on. Meso-American cultures often employed jade, flint and obsidian in the crafting of items of warfare, ritual and ceremony. The Omlecs used obsidian to create black axes, often polished with flint handles.

[TAB]Special Services Group (SSG) is an independent commando brigade of the Pakistan Army. It is an elite special operations force similar to the ,Special Air Service and United States Army Special Forces(Green Berets). Official numbers are put at 2,100 men, in 3 Battalions; however the actual strength is classified. It is estimated to have been increased to 4 Battalions, with the eventual formation of 2 Brigades of Special Forces (6 Battalions).

[TAB]The Katipunan (also known as the Katipuneros) was a Philippine revolutionary organization founded by Filipino rebels in Manila, in 1892, which aimed to gain independence from Spain. The word "Katipunan" comes from the root word "tipon", an indigenous Tagalog word, meaning: "society" or "gather". Its official revolutionary meanings are translated as Kataas-taasang, Kagalang-galangang Katipunan ng mga Anak ng Bayan (Supreme and Venerable Society of the Children of the Nation). The word were used by Filipino revolutionary rebel leaders. The word were used by Filipino revolutionary rebel leaders. Katipunan is also known by its acronym, KKK (not to be mistaken with the "Ku Klux Klan").[PARAGRAPH:1]The KKK had 3 kinds of members. The Katipon (member), the Kawal (soldier), and the Bayani (hero). Each kind of member has different passwords that are secretly used for passage during meetings or entering hideouts.

[TAB]The bireme was introduced by the Phoenicians around 800 BC and became the leading warship of the Mediterranean world in the centuries to follow.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Phoenicians were astute naval architects. They lowered the platforms where the oarsmen were seated (crinolines) to increase vessel stability. The battering ram was covered in bronze. The decorative poop was bent and resembled the tail of a scorpion. The balustrade of the battle platform was covered with the shields of warriors, the bireme was thus partially covered in a primitive 'armor'. These war biremes were typically 30 meters in length and 5 meters wide. Phoenicians were the finest seamen of their time, and were often employed as mercenaries.

[TAB]The Romans called this pre-Celtic people Pictii, or "Painted," although Claudius' words are proof that (as claimed by many historians), the ancient Picts actually tattooed their bodies with designs. To the non-Roman Celtic world of Scots and Irish and the many tribes of Belgic England and Wales they were known as "Cruithni" and for many centuries they represented the unbridled fury of a people who refused to be brought under the yoke of Rome or any foreign invader.

[TAB]The Ghost Dance is a millennialist spiritual movement among Native Americans in the United States that began toward the end of 1888 and reached its peak just before the Wounded Knee Massacre of 1890. Although the religion is still practiced, it enjoyed only a short period of popularity. Believers in the Ghost Dance spirituality are convinced that performing the Ghost Dance will eventually reunite them with their ancestors coming by railway from the spirit world. The ancestor spirits are called upon to heal the sick and to help protect Mother Earth. Meanwhile, the world will return to a primordial state of natural beauty, opening up to swallow up all other those who do not have a strong spirituality based upon the earth.

[TAB]These nomadic tribes live for war. War, and horses. A Scythian rider will drink the blood of their first kill as a right of passage. They scalp their victims and wear their skin like handkerchiefs as a sign of status in their tribe. They're even known to flay an entire enemy and use their hide as a cloak, or as a cover for their quivers. In fact, if a Scythian tribesman doesn't make a kill during a given year, they're left out of their main annual ceremony, where warriors drink wine from the gilded skulls of their enemies.

[TAB]The Ghulam warriors were slave-soldiers in service of kings and generals throughout the Turkish and Persian Empires of the Medieval and Early Modern eras. Since the break-up of the Abbasid Caliphate, the Ghulam were grouped into whole armies. They were usually Turkic in origin and fought as cavalrymen. The Ghulam seem to have lived celibate lives. The absence of family life and offspring was one of the reasons why Ghulam, even when attaining power, generally failed to start dynasties or proclaim their independence. The only exception to this was the Ghaznavid dynasty of Afghanistan, which originated amongst the Ghulam of the Samanid dynasty.

[TAB]In August 1972, the government established the People's Militia, known as the Victory Pioneers (Guulwadayaal). Although a wing of the army, the militia worked under the supervision of the Political Bureau of the presidency. After the SRSP's formation in 1976, the militia became part of the party apparatus. Largely because of the need for military reserves, militia membership increased from 2,500 in 1977 to about 10,000 in 1979, and to approximately 20,000 by 1990. After the collapse of Siad Barre's regime, the People's Militia, like other military elements, disintegrated.

[TAB]Guerrilla tactics were used extensively by the forces of the Afrikaner republics in the Second Boer War in South Africa 1899-1902. After the British defeated the Boer armies in conventional warfare and occupied their capitals of Pretoria and Bloemfontein, Boer commandos reverted to mobile warfare. Units led by leaders such as Christian de Wet harassed slow-moving British columns and attacked railway lines and encampments. The Boers were almost all mounted and possessed long range magazine loaded rifles. This gave them the ability to attack quickly and cause many casualties before retreating rapidly when British reinforcements arrived. In the early period of the guerrilla war, Boer commandoes could be very large, containing several thousand men and even field artillery. However, as their supplies of food and ammunition gave out, the Boers increasingly broke up into smaller units and relied on captured British arms and ammunition.

[TAB]The Champa warriors used elephants as their main battle force. The Champa placed a single warrior atop a platform on the elephant's back. The warrior would weild a spear or shoot arrows at his enemies. The Cham armies are regarded as being warlike and cruel. A Chinese writer described a troop of Cham imperial guards who fought with bows made of bamboo, crossbows, javelins, and spears who rode elephants into battle.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les guerriers de Champa ont employé des éléphants en tant que leur force principale de bataille. Le champa a placé un guerrier simple placé sur une plateforme sur l'éléphant en arrière. Le guerrier weild une lance ou des flèches de pousse à ses ennemis. Les armées de Cham sont considérées comme étant guerrières et cruelles. Un auteur chinois a décrit une troupe de gardes impériales de Cham qui ont combattu avec des arcs faits de bambou, arbalètes, javelots, et lances qui sont montées des éléphants dans la bataille.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Champa Krieger benutzten Elefanten als ihre Hauptschlachtkraft. Das champa setzte einen einzelnen Krieger auf einer Plattform auf den Elefanten zurück. Der Krieger wurde weild eine Stange oder Eintragfadenpfeile an seinen Feinden. Die Chamarmeen werden als seiend kriegerisch und grausam angesehen. Ein chinesischer Verfasser beschrieb eine Truppe des imperialen Schutzes des Cham, der mit den Bögen kämpfte, die vom Bambus, von den crossbows, von den Speeren und von den Stangen, die, gebildet wurden Elefanten in Schlacht ritten.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]I guerrieri di Champa hanno usato gli elefanti come loro forza principale di battaglia. Il champa ha disposto un singolo guerriero in cima ad una piattaforma sull'elefante indietro. Il guerriero weild un germoglio o frecce del tiro ai suoi nemici. Gli eserciti del Cham sono considerare come essendo warlike e crudeli. Un produttore cinese ha descritto una truppa delle protezioni imperiali del Cham che hanno combattuto con gli archi fatti di bambù, di crossbows, dei javelins e dei germogli che hanno guidato gli elefanti nella battaglia.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Los guerreros de Champa utilizaron elefantes como su fuerza principal de la batalla. El champa colocó a solo guerrero encima de una plataforma en el elefante detrás. El guerrero weild una lanza o las flechas del lanzamiento en sus enemigos. Miran a los ejércitos del Cham como siendo guerreros y crueles. Un escritor chino describió a tropa de los protectores imperiales del Cham que lucharon con los arcos hechos de bambú, de crossbows, de javelins, y de las lanzas que montaron elefantes en batalla.

TEXT.English: [TAB]During the Late Middle Ages, mercenary forces grew in importance in Europe, as veterans from the Hundred Years War and other conflicts came to see soldiering as a profession rather than a temporary activity, and commanders sought long-term professionals rather than temporary feudal levies to fight their wars. Swiss mercenaries (Reisläufer) were valued throughout Late Medieval Europe for the power of their determined mass attack in deep columns with the pike and halberd. Hiring them was made even more attractive because entire ready-made Swiss mercenary contingents could be obtained by simply contracting with their local governments, the various Swiss cantonsthe cantons had a form of militia system in which the soldiers were bound to serve and were trained and equipped to do so. It should be noted, however, that the Swiss also hired themselves out individually or in small bands.[PARAGRAPH:1]The warriors of the Swiss cantons had gradually developed a reputation throughout Europe as skilled soldiers, due to their successful defense of their liberties against their Austrian Habsburg overlords, starting as early as the late thirteenth century, including such remarkable upset victories over heavily-armoured knights as Morgarten and Laupen. This was furthered by later successful campaigns of regional expansion (mainly into Italy). By the fifteenth century they were greatly valued as mercenary soldiers, particularly following their series of notable victories in the Burgundian Wars in the latter part of the century. As a result, bands of men, sometime acting independently, other times under the banners of their cantons, marched off to foreign lands to fight in the causes of others, for pay. The native term Reisläufer literally means "one who goes to war" and is derived from Middle High German Reise, meaning "military campaign."[PARAGRAPH:1]The Swiss, with their head-down attack in huge columns with the long pike, refusal to take prisoners, and consistent record of victory, were greatly feared and admiredfor instance, Machiavelli addresses their system of combat at length in The Prince. The Valois Kings of France, in fact, considered it a virtual impossibility to take the field of battle without Swiss pikemen as the infantry core of their armies. (Although often referred to as "pikemen," the Swiss mercenary units also contained halberdiers as well until several decades into the sixteenth century, as well as a small number of skirmishers armed with crossbows or crude firearms to precede the rapid advance of the attack column.)[PARAGRAPH:1]The young men who went off to fight, and sometimes die, in foreign service had several incentiveslimited economic options in the still largely-rural cantons; adventure; pride in the reputation of the Swiss as soldiers; and finally what military historian Sir Charles Oman describes as a pure love of combat and warfighting in and of itself, forged by two centuries of conflict.

[TAB]The Seleukidoi took to the thureophoroi and went one better, armoring their improved unit to the teeth and giving him a longer spear with a wider blade. These men are exceedingly well trained and often can make the difference in any battle simply by making their fearsome appearance known. They carry theuros shields with silver medusa heads emblazoned on the front and wear helmets that are strengthened with mail 'veils', making their appearance even more fearsome. As if this was not enough, they carry heavy javelins to break enemy lines and long spears to drive the charge home when they are finished with their javelin throwing. They fight in an organized formation, but not in a phalanx, and are thus more mobile than the Phalanx. They are the best and fittest men within the Hypastistai and are often able to break an enemy line. They have no real weakness in battle, but are extremely expensive to maintain, so their numbers are always few and far between. They should be used as an elite shock infantry, because this is the role for which they were made. They should be well supported, because if these hardy and grizzled veterans rout, it could induce the rest of the army to do so as well![NEWLINE][TAB]Historically, the Seleukidos Thorakitai Argyraspidai were a small elite unit of the Hypastistai that were the leaders of an infantry charge. Their heavy armor was elaborate and expensive, making their numbers never more than one thousand (among six thousand Hypastistai). They were used during many battles, but were notoriously absent from Raphia due to their being refitted after a battle with rebels supported by the Parthai. They slowly dwindled in number as the kingdom's finances did the same. They were no longer a factor when the Seleukidod king fought the Romaioi in Makedonia, a battle at which they would have been very much appreciated. If a capable ruler were to take the Seleukidos throne and carefully manage the kingdom's finances, perhaps he could utilize these fine soldiers far longer than happened historically.

[TAB]The Barlas were a Turko-Mongol nomadic confederation of Central Asia and the chief tribe of the Timurid emperors who ruled much of Central Asia, Iran, and South Asia in the Middle Ages. The Barlas were descendants of the Mongol warlord Bodonchir who was also considered the direct ancestor of Genghis Khan. The Turko-Mongol conqueror Timur was from a noble family of the Barlas clan.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Mughal Empire of South Asia was founded by Zahir ud-din Muhammad Babur, a descendent of the Timurids. The Barlas family name is used by the descendents of Mughals in Pakistan.

[TAB]The Apollonian Guard was a unit of the Trojan Army, named after the largest and most important gate of Troy, the Apallonian Gate, and were noted as some of the greatest and most experienced soldiers of the Trojans. These soldiers were usually put into the front-line of battles, and were noted to be a unit of perfection in javelin-throwing and horse-riding. They were led solely by Poludamas, an important general and military advisor of King Priam, and a lueitenant and friend of Hector. Much of the unit was destroyed in the first battle of the Trojan War, when Hector and Poludamas led the Apallonian Guard against Achilles and his elite soldiers when they raided the Grand Temple of Apollo, the patron god of Troy. The rest were wiped out in a final stand at the Citadel of Troy, the area were the palace, temples and the Towers of Ilium laid. There Poludamas died, seven days after Hector's death at the hands of Achilles, and directly before Paris, also known as Alexandros, killed Achilles in the Gardens of Troy, and then was killed in combat, then afterwards Helen did a whorish act, and took of her top to seduce King Meneleus of Sparta, her ex-husband, to spare her.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Tomoios are one of many tribes that make up the Tupi family. Like other natives from the region, they were assimilated, enslaved or simply exterminated by Portuguese and Spanish settlers, nearly leading to their complete annihilation, with the exception of a few isolated communities. The remnants of these tribes are today confined to indigenous reservations or acculturated to some degree into the dominant society. The Tomoios were a formidable presence within the Amazon rain forests when the Poruguese first arrived in Brazil.

[TAB]Uyghur history is the story of an obscure nomadic tribe from the Altai Mountains rising to challenge the Chinese Empire and ultimately becoming the diplomatic arm of the Mongol invasion. The ancestors of the Uyghur include the nomadic Gaoche people and possibly the Tocharian peoples of the Tarim Basin. The Uyghur participated in a coalition of Tiele under the leadership of the Syr-Tardush tribe, who allied with the Chinese Sui Empire in 603 to defeat Tardu Khan and win their independence. In 744 the Uyghur, together with other related subject tribes (the Basmil and Qarluq), defeated the Gokturk Khanate and founded the Uyghur Empire at Mount Ötüken, which lasted for about 100 years.

[TAB]The Mountain Hunters are one of the oldest types of units in the Romanian military. This is an "infantry with special abilities" branch and it is dedicated to mountain warfare.[NEWLINE][TAB] The Mountain Hunters do not consider themselves "special forces". "We like others to call us that way", said Lt-Col Cristinel Cernea, commander of the 21st battalion, 2nd Brigade, the most elite Mountain Hunters battalion in the country. The Mountain Hunters are locally called Vanatori de Munte, or VM's for short.[NEWLINE][TAB]On the 3rd of November, 1916, the 1st Mountain Corps was established, opening a very important chapter in the history of this elite branch. This event was remembered on the 3rd of November 2001, when the Mountain Hunters celebrated 85 years of existence. The elite branch of the infantry existed in the past as well, however it was in 1916 when they started to be called "Vanatori de Munte" (Mountain Hunters) and when their main purpose was set to be fighting in mountainous regions.

[TAB]The main duty of the king in Vedic civilizations was to protect the tribe. He was aided by two functionaries, the "purohita" (chaplain) and the "senani" (army chief; "sena": army). The former not only gave advice to the ruler but also practiced spells and charms for success in war. Soldiers on foot ("patti") and on chariots ("rathin"), armed with bow and arrow were common. The king employed "spasa" (spies) and "duta"s (messengers). He often got a ceremonial gift, "bali", from the people.

[TAB]The Viet Cong is a special unit for the Vietnamese civilization. Viet Cong were used by the Vietnamese army as a fast-moving military unit that could easily go from place to place in a relatively short amount of time. Their elusiveness (when needed) and their knowledge of the terrain made them extremely difficult fighters. The Viet Cong were also highly motivatived and would endure terrible conditions to keep up the fight against the enemy no matter how long it lasted.

[TAB] The Vytis, or the Chaser, represents the knight on the Coat of Arms of Lithuania. Various interpretations about what it represents exist; one being that Vytis represents the Lithuanian god of thunder. The Vytis may also represent a Lithuanian war god. The Lithuanian Coat of Arms is one of the oldest coats of arms in Europe, and rather than containing symbols adopted from the coat of arms of dynasties, the symbols are adopted from duke portrait seals. This greatly differs from the traditional coat of arms of other European countries.
TEXT.French: [TAB] Le Vytis, ou le Chaser, représente le chevalier sur le Blason de la Lituanie. Diverses interprétations sur ce qu'il représente existent, l'une étant que représente le lituanien Vytis dieu de la foudre. Le Vytis peuvent également représenter un dieu de guerre lituanien. Les armoiries du lituanien est l'un des plus vieux blasons en Europe, et plutôt que d'adopter des symboles contenant le blason de dynasties, les symboles sont adoptées portrait du duc phoques. Cela diffère grandement de la traditionnelle armoiries des autres pays européens.
TEXT.German: [TAB] Die Vytis, oder die Chaser, der Ritter ist auf dem Wappen von Litauen. Verschiedene Interpretationen über das, was sie existieren; ein, dass die litauische Vytis ist Gott der Donner. Die Vytis Mai auch eine litauische Krieg Gott. Die litauische Wappen ist eines der ältesten Wappen in Europa, und anstatt mit Symbolen aus nahm das Wappen von Dynastien, die Symbole werden angenommen Porträt von Herzog Dichtungen. Dies unterscheidet sich erheblich von der traditionellen Wappen von anderen europäischen Ländern.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB] Il Vytis, o il Chaser, rappresenta il cavaliere sul Stemma della Lituania. Diverse interpretazioni su ciò che essa rappresenta esistono; uno che rappresenta il lituano Vytis dio del tuono. Il Vytis può anche rappresentare un dio lituano guerra. Il lituano Stemma è uno dei più antichi stemmi in Europa, e piuttosto che contengono simboli adottati dal stemma di dinastie, i simboli sono adottati dal duca ritratto sigilli. Questo si differenzia notevolmente dal tradizionale stemma di altri paesi europei.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB] El Vytis, o el Chaser, representa el caballo en el Escudo de Armas de Lituania. Diversas interpretaciones sobre lo que representa existen; siendo uno de ellos que representa el lituano Vytis dios del trueno. El Vytis también puede representar un dios de la guerra lituano. El lituano Escudo de Armas es uno de los más antiguos escudos de armas en Europa, y en lugar de símbolos que contiene entre el escudo de armas de las dinastías, los símbolos se aprobó duque retrato de las focas. Esto difiere de la tradicional escudo de armas de otros países europeos.

TEXT.English: During the Anglo-Norman invasion of Wales, the Welsh Longbow was put into use. The English soon learned how powerful this weapon could be, and began to recruit Welsh Longbowmen into their own army. The Welsh Longbow is most famous for its role in the Battle of Agincourt, and the Hundred Years' War. The Longbowmen, using the Welsh Longbow, would fire a rain of arrows and the enemy. The Welsh Longbow was used unil the development of gunpowder. Overall, the weapon was a powerful type of medieval longbow. The Welsh Longbow was difficult to master because of its draw weight. Because of the difficulty, many users of the Welsh Longbow were eventually deformed in their arms and wrists.
TEXT.French: Pendant l'invasion Anglo-Normande du Pays de Gales, l'arc de Gallois a été mis dans l'utilisation. L'anglais a bientôt appris comment puissant cette arme pourrait être, et a commencé à recruter des Longbowmen de Gallois dans leur propre armée. L'arc de Gallois est le plus célèbre pour son rôle dans la bataille d'Agincourt, et les cent guerres des ans. Les Longbowmen, en utilisant l'arc de Gallois, mettraient le feu à une pluie des flèches et de l'ennemi. L'arc de Gallois était unil utilisé le développement de la poudre. De façon générale, l'arme était un type puissant d'arc médiéval. Il était difficile maîtriser l'arc de Gallois en raison de son poids d'aspiration. En raison de la difficulté, beaucoup d'utilisateurs de l'arc de Gallois ont été par la suite déformés dans leurs bras et poignets.
TEXT.German: Während der Anglo-Normannischen Invasion von Wales, wurde der Waliser Longbow in Gebrauch gesetzt. Englisch erlernte bald, wie leistungsfähig diese Waffe sein könnte, und fing an, Waliser Longbowmen in ihre eigene Armee einzuziehen. Der Waliser Longbow ist für seine Rolle in der Schlacht von Agincourt und der Hundertjährigen Kriege am berühmtesten. Die Longbowmen mit dem Waliser Longbow, würden einen Regen der Pfeile und des Feindes abfeuern. Der Waliser Longbow war verwendetes unil die Entwicklung des Schießpulvers. Gesamt, war die Waffe eine leistungsfähige Art mittelalterliches longbow. Der Waliser Longbow war schwierig, wegen seines Betraggewichts zu erarbeiten. Wegen der Schwierigkeit wurden viele Benutzer des Walisers Longbow schließlich in ihren Armen und in Handgelenken verformt.
TEXT.Italian: Durante l'invasione Anglo-Normanna del Galles, la Lingua gallese Longbow è stata messa in uso. L'inglese presto ha imparato quanto potente questa arma potrebbe essere ed ha cominciato a reclutare i Longbowmen di Lingua gallese nel loro proprio esercito. La Lingua gallese Longbow è più famosa per il relativo ruolo nella battaglia di Agincourt e le cento guerre degli anni. I Longbowmen, usando la Lingua gallese Longbow, infornerebbero una pioggia delle frecce e del nemico. La Lingua gallese Longbow era unil usato lo sviluppo di polvere nera. In generale, l'arma era un tipo potente di longbow medioevale. La Lingua gallese Longbow era difficile da acquistare padronanza di a causa del relativo peso di tiraggio. A causa della difficoltà, molti utenti della Lingua gallese Longbow finalmente sono stati deformati in loro armi e polsi.
TEXT.Spanish: Durante la invasión Anglo-Normanda de País de Gales, el Galés Longbow fue puesto en uso. El inglés pronto aprendió cómo es de gran alcance esta arma podría ser, y comenzó a reclutar a Longbowmen Galés en su propio ejército. El Galés Longbow es el más famoso por su papel en la batalla de Agincourt, y las cientos guerras de años. Los Longbowmen, usando el Galés Longbow, encenderían una lluvia de las flechas y del enemigo. El Galés Longbow era unil usado el desarrollo de la pólvora. Total, la arma era un tipo de gran alcance de longbow medieval. El Galés Longbow era difícil de dominar debido a su peso del drenaje. Debido a la dificultad, muchos usuarios del Galés Longbow fueron deformidos eventual en sus brazos y muñecas.

TEXT.English: [TAB]1 Engineer Regiment (JDF) is a unit of the Jamaica Defence Force primarily responsible for providing military and civil engineering. The regiment was formed in 1992 after a requirement was identified for increased military and civil engineering capability for the JDF than could be provided by the then existing structure. At the time, all JDF engineering capacity was provided by the Construction Squadron and the Engineering Unit of the Support and Services Battalion. The regiment today consists of a total of four distinct sub-units.

[TAB]In the winter of 200 BC, following a siege of Taiyuan, Emperor Gao of China personally led a military campaign against Modu. At the battle of Baideng, he was ambushed reputedly by 300,000 elite Xiongnu cavalry. The emperor was cut off from supplies and reinforcements for seven days, only narrowly escaping capture.[PARAGRAPH:1]After the defeat at Pingcheng, the Han emperor abandoned a military solution to the Xiongnu threat. Instead, in 198 BC, the courtier Liu Jing was despatched for negotiations. The peace settlement eventually reached between the parties included a Han princess given in marriage to the shanyu (called heqin or "harmonious kinship"); periodic gifts of silk, liquor and rice to the Xiongnu; equal status between the states; and the Great Wall as mutual border.

[TAB]The people of the Western Sahara are descended from two known tribes that were the original inhabitants of the territory: the Zenata and the Sanhaja. Beginning in the seventh century, they resisted the invasion of Muslim Arab peoples from the east, but they accepted Islam. Under the influence of Islam, the first unified movement of the population was created, resulting in the establishment of the Almoravid dynasty. At the end of the 13th century, Arab Yeminite people, known as Maqil, invaded the Western Sahara and created a new political and social culture. The Mauritanian Thirty-Year War (1644-74) was the unsuccessful final effort to repel the Yemeni Maqil Arab invaders led by the Beni Hassan tribe. The descendants of the Yemeni Beni Hassan warriors became the upper stratum of Moorish society.

The Yoruba had their own Art of War. As part of rituals, which the male Yoruba needed to become men, they were trained from their early childhood on to be specialists in disciplines like horseback riding, swimming and hunting.
TEXT.German: Die Yoruba hatten seit jeher ihre eigenen Kampfkünste. Als Teil der Rituale, die die Männer der Yoruba zum Eintritt in die "Männlichkeit" benötigen, werden sie von frühauf darauf getrimmt in Disziplinen wie Reiten, Schwimmen und der Jagd Spezialisten zu sein.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Zaporozhian Cossacks were Cossacks who lived in Zaporizhya, a region in Central Ukraine. The Zaporozhian Host grew rapidly in the 15th century by serfs escaping the Polish Lithuanian Commonwealth. The base and fortress of the Cossacks was the Zaporozhian Sich, which was originally built in the area known as Zaporizhia. During the course of the 16th, 17th and well into the 18th century, the Zaporozhian Cossacks became a strong political and military forced that challenged the authority of the Poland-Lithuania, the Ottoman Empire and its vassal, the Crimean Khanate, and the Tsardom of Russia. The Host underwent a sequence of conflicts and alliances involving the three powers before being destroyed in the late 18th century by the Russian Empire.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les Cosaques de Zaporozhian étaient les Cosaques qui ont habité dans Zaporizhya, une région en Ukraine centrale. Le centre serveur de Zaporozhian s'est développé rapidement au 15ème siècle par des serfs échappant au Commonwealth lithuanien polonais. La base et la forteresse des Cosaques étaient le Zaporozhian Sich, qui a été à l'origine construit dans le secteur connu sous le nom de Zaporizhia. Pendant le 16ème, le 17ème et bien dans le 18ème siècle, les Cosaques de Zaporozhian est devenu un obligatoire politique et militaire fort qui a défié l'autorité de la Pologne-Lithuanie, l'empire de tabouret et son vassal, le Khanate criméen, et le Tsardom de la Russie. Le centre serveur a subi un ordre des conflits et des alliances impliquant les trois puissances avant d'être détruit vers la fin du 18ème siècle par l'empire russe.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Zaporozhian Kosaken waren Kosaken, die in Zaporizhya wohnten, eine Region in zentraler Ukraine. Der Zaporozhian Wirt wuchs schnell im 15. Jahrhundert durch die Sklaven, die dem polnischen litauischen Commonwealth entgehen. Die Unterseite und die Festung der Kosaken waren das Zaporozhian Sich, das ursprünglich im Bereich errichtet wurde, der als Zaporizhia bekannt ist. Während des 16. wurde 17. und gut in das 18. Jahrhundert, die Zaporozhian Kosaken ein starkes politisches und militärisches Zwangs-, das die Berechtigung des Polen-Litauens, des Ottoman-Reiches und seines vassal herausforderten, das KrimKhanate und das Tsardom von Rußland. Der Wirt machte eine Reihenfolge der Konflikte und der Bündnisse durch, welche die drei Energien mit einbeziehen, bevor er Ende des 18. Jahrhunderts durch das russische Reich zerstört wurde.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]I Cossacks di Zaporozhian erano Cossacks che hanno vissuto in Zaporizhya, una regione in Ucraina centrale. L'ospite di Zaporozhian si è sviluppato velocemente nel quindicesimo secolo dai servi che fuoriescono il commonwealth lituano polacco. Durante il corso del sedicesimo, il diciassettesimo e facilmente per il diciottesimo secolo, i Cossacks di Zaporozhian si è trasformato in in un forzato politico e militare forte che ha sfidato l'autorità della Polonia-Lituania, l'impero del Ottoman ed il relativo vassal, nel Khanate della Crimea e nel Tsardom della Russia. L'ospite ha subito una sequenza dei conflitti e delle alleanze che coinvolgono le tre alimentazioni prima del essere distruttoe verso la fine del diciottesimo secolo dall'impero russo.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Los Cossacks de Zaporozhian eran los Cossacks que vivieron en Zaporizhya, una región en Ucrania central. El anfitrión de Zaporozhian creció rápidamente en el décimo quinto siglo por los siervos que escapaban la Commonwealth lituana polaca.
